event_text: m_c can't keep this secret anymore. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/request/requests} a Clan meeting, where {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/reveal/reveals} the terrible secret {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}{VERB/m_c/'ve/'s} kept; {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} killed mur_c.
r_c is stunned when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/discover/discovers} m_c carelessly bragging about killing mur_c to a wandering loner.
m_c is truthful when r_c questions {PRONOUN/m_c/object} about mur_c's strange death. m_c claims that mur_c deserved to die after what {PRONOUN/mur_c/subject} did to m_c.
m_c boldly confesses to the entire Clan that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} killed mur_c. m_c claims that mur_c deserved to pay for what {PRONOUN/mur_c/subject} did.
m_c's cold eyes don't blink when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/are/is} accused of murdering mur_c, and only simply states that the Clan is better off without mur_c anyways.
m_c doesn't change expressions in the slightest when r_c accuses {PRONOUN/m_c/object} of murdering mur_c. Who cares?
r_c avoids m_c at all costs after accidentally witnessing mur_c's murder. r_c knows {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} can't keep it a secret but is terrified of what m_c might do.

r_c gathers all the courage {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/have/has} and quietly tells m_c {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/know/knows} what {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} did to mur_c. m_c glares menacingly and threatens r_c with the same fate if {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/don't/doesn't} keep {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mouth shut.
m_c laughs menacingly as r_c accuses {PRONOUN/m_c/object} of murdering mur_c. So what if {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} did? What is r_c going to do about it?
m_c can't keep this secret anymore. When {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/find/finds} {PRONOUN/m_c/self} alone with r_c, {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/tell/tells} the story of mur_c's death.

r_c overheard m_c muttering in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} sleep, claws slashing at the air. {PRONOUN/m_c/poss/CAP} muttering confirms what r_c always suspected -  m_c was the one responsible for mur_c's death.
m_c went for a long walk this morning, deep in thought.
m_c disappears for a few days, then returns to camp with a acc_singular around {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} neck.
m_c accidentally trespasses onto o_c_n's territory.
m_c spends the evening regaling the Clan with stories of story_list.
m_c was trying to fluff up {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} nest when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} saw a thorn inside of {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} bedding. Another prank, but it could not fool {PRONOUN/m_c/object}!
m_c wasn't looking where {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/were/was} going and tripped over a small trunk, but came out of it with only {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pride bruised.
m_c misstepped and slipped from a rock, but landed on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} feet nimbly, {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} Clanmates commenting on the show of dexterity.
m_c tossed a snake out of the camp before it could bite someone.
m_c tries to convince r_c to run away with {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
m_c believes {PRONOUN/m_c/subject}'{VERB/m_c/re/s} meant for something greater.
m_c believes {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/are/is} part of a new prophecy.
m_c went missing for a few days.
m_c is caught breaking the Warrior Code.
m_c is caught outside of the Clan's territory.
m_c considers, as {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/look/looks} out over the Clan, if perhaps this isn't where {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/belong/belongs}.
The world around {PRONOUN/m_c/object} feels smaller lately; m_c looks out at the horizon and yearns for something unnameable.
m_c's dreams are filled with flashing teeth and blood-scent. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/wake/wakes} up screaming.
m_c thought {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} saw a familiar wispy form lingering at the edge of camp, but the ghost disappeared before {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} could be sure.
The older cats look fondly upon the kits who are dashing in and out of leaf piles at the edge of camp.
m_c and r_c begin a small camp snowball fight while on guard duty, eventually getting the whole Clan to join in.
m_c encourages r_c to play in the snow with {PRONOUN/m_c/object} during a patrol.
m_c always seems to have acc_plural stuck in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} fur.
r_c finds acc_plural while out on a walk and decides to give them to m_c.
m_c finds acc_plural while out on a walk and decides to keep them.
m_c was given acc_plural as a congratulations, r_c watches from the side with a jealous glint in {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} eyes.

r_c gives m_c something to adorn {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt as congratulations.
m_c found a mysterious acc_singular growing in the frost and decided to wear it.
The war with o_c_n is beginning to disrupt the daily lives of c_n, forcing them to adapt to new routines and living situations in order to better defend themselves.
The tension between c_n and o_c_n is palpable, with even the smallest actions potentially leading to violence.
m_c and r_c are so cuddled up and cozy in their nest they almost miss the dawn patrol.
m_c listens bashfully as r_c tells the story of how {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} fell in love with {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} mate to a group of starry-eyed kits.
m_c watches r_c give an elder the best piece of prey on the pile. {PRONOUN/m_c/subject/CAP} {VERB/m_c/feel/feels} lucky to have such a kind cat as {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} mate.
m_c and r_c watch the Clan's kits play and daydream about having their own one day.
m_c and r_c take a late night patrol out of camp to watch the sun rise.
m_c and r_c take an early evening patrol out of camp to watch the moon rise.
m_c sits still as r_c helps remove some leftover Leaf-bare fluff from the back of {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} neck.
It's tough working in such extreme heat. m_c and r_c spend their evening relaxing together and cooling down in the shade.
m_c gives r_c a acc_singular to make up for a bad fight between them.
m_c gifts {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} beloved r_c with a acc_singular to wear in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.

m_c thinks about retiring.

m_c chases fireflies around the camp, while the older warriors sleep.

m_c and r_c lead a small leaf-gathering hunt, which the adult cats watch with amused purrs.
m_c and r_c play with the leaves around the camp.

m_c is being comforted by r_c after having nightmares about the big, bad o_c_n cats.
m_c was playing with acc_plural earlier, and decides to wear some of them.

As the wind blows many petals in the camp, m_c picks a few to decorate {PRONOUN/m_c/self}.
As the wind brings many fallen leaves in the camp, m_c picks a acc_singular to decorate {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.
m_c is just too cute - r_c gives {PRONOUN/m_c/object} a pretty acc_singular as a gift.
r_c gives m_c a pretty acc_singular {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} found while playing.
m_c starts bringing a pretty acc_singular everywhere {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/go/goes}, and r_c loudly complains that {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/want/wants} one, too.
No matter how hard r_c tries, there's always something stuck in m_c's fur.
m_c finds some acc_singular to wear in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} fur to impress r_c!
m_c is scolded after sneaking out of camp.

m_c and r_c sneak out of camp to see the moon rise.
m_c and r_c try to sneak out of camp, but are caught by their mentors.

m_c and r_c sneak out of camp to go bird watching.
m_c and r_c play in the fallen leaves outside of camp.
m_c and r_c play in the snow outside of camp.

m_c and r_c were chatting about their day and the chores they finished when r_c mentioned {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} liked the smell of wild fruit. m_c decides to wear acc_plural on {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt, hoping that r_c notices {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.

m_c, for the umpteenth time, hears r_c complaining about the dry rye stalks underneath {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} paws when {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/finish/finishes} cleaning the elders' den and got an idea. The next day, m_c adorns {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt with acc_plural.
m_c gets dared to hunt outside in the snow alone, and returns with acc_singular in {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.

m_c is nearly blindsided by r_c as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/walk/walks} into camp after a long training day, listening to the kit squeak about a type of feather. r_c leads m_c to the nursery, where {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} carefully put acc_plural in m_c's fur.
m_c is struggling to cope with the violence and chaos of war surrounding {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, finding it difficult to wake up in the morning due to the stress and strain of constant battle training.
m_c feels like {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} might be growing up too fast in the midst of war.
m_c was caught sharing prey with a kittypet, who was chased off by a patrol.
m_c was seen touching noses with a kittypet. Scandalous!

m_c correctly warns the leader of an ambush, thanks to {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} clairvoyant nature.
m_c spends {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} day communing with StarClan, attempting to figure out a recent prophecy.

m_c has been worried that c_n will lose the knowledge r_c has gained through {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} long life, but by sitting with r_c and discussing {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} experiences, m_c will ensure the lessons learned in the past are never forgotten.
m_c was seen loudly bickering with the medicine cat of o_c_n.
m_c was seen talking with a traveling loner healer on the border.
m_c's knowledge of herbs and healing is being put to the test, with injuries becoming more severe in the midst of war.
m_c watches every little thing around {PRONOUN/m_c/object} for any omen that indicates what the Clan should do in the war. The losses weigh heavy on the hearts of every cat.
m_c preps battle herbs into small bundles to rush to the battlefield in case of severe injuries.
c_n is in a badly need of herbs, and m_c knows it, but can't bring {PRONOUN/m_c/self} to leave {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} patients' side.
m_c hopes to find the herbs that c_n needs in the war, and goes to look for them even in this Leaf-bare's harsh weather.

m_c is struggling to accept the fact that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} may have to step up as leader if r_c loses {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} last life. How could {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/go/goes} on without {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} beloved leader? How difficult will it to be to lead in {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} stead?

m_c thinks about retiring.

m_c calls a Clan meeting to give an important announcement.

The Clan worked hard to gather plenty of fresh-kill, but woke up to find pawprints leading away from the fresh-kill pile, and missing prey.
The Clan gathered a stockpile of food to save, the more the better, but one night the fresh-kill pile was drastically reduced and paw prints were found on the ground.
The o_c_n medicine cat comes asking if c_n has any herbs to spare. Unfortunately, the c_n herb stocks are far too low and c_n is unable to provide any help.

A medicine cat from o_c_n comes comes to c_n, asking for herbs to heal their sick Clanmates. c_n quickly shoos them away, not willing to admit that they already don't have enough to support themselves.
The o_c_n medicine cat comes asking if c_n has any given_herb to spare. Graciously, your Clan decides to aid their allies and share the herbs.
The medicine cat apprentice from o_c_n comes asking for given_herb. They refuse to say why their Clan needs them but c_n still provides them with what they need.
The o_c_n medicine cat comes asking if c_n has any given_herb to spare. However, c_n only has enough for themselves and they refuse to share.
The medicine cat apprentice from o_c_n comes asking for herbs. They refuse to say why their Clan needs them and c_n decides not to share their precious few given_herb.
The o_c_n medicine cat apprentice comes to c_n's camp, pleading for help with a yellowcough epidemic. c_n provides the cat with some of their extra lungwort.
A medicine cat from o_c_n comes to c_n, asking for lungwort to heal a case of yellowcough. c_n has some extra, and so decides to share with their allies.
The o_c_n medicine cat apprentice comes to c_n's camp, pleading for help with a yellowcough epidemic. However, c_n has nothing that they are willing to share.
A medicine cat from o_c_n comes to c_n, asking for lungwort to heal a case of yellowcough. However, c_n hardly has enough for their own Clan and so refuses.
o_c_n breaks into the camp and ravages the herb stores, taking some for themselves and destroying the rest.
Some sort of pest got into the herb stores and completely destroyed them. c_n will have to clean it out and start over anew.
Abnormally strong winds blew through the camp last night and scattered the herb store into a useless state.
Some kind of blight has infected the herb stores. c_n has no choice but to clear out all the old herbs.
Freezing temperatures have not just affected the cats. It's also frostbitten the stored herbs. They're useless now and will have to be replaced.
The newleaf rain has left the air humid and the whole camp damp. The herb stores are found to be growing mold and have to be thrown out.
The persistent, dry heat managed to cause a small fire in the herb stores. While no one was injured, the herbs are little more than ashes now.
As the herb stores are being inspected, it's noticed that some of the given_herb went bad. They'll need to be replaced.
The Clan has gathered plenty of moss recently, time to refresh the dens!
The herb stores have quite a lot of given_herb, the excess is given back to the earth
r_c is so proud of how far {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} child has grown. With a look of pride, r_c presents m_c with acc_plural as a congratulations.
r_c is so proud of how far {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} kit has grown. With a look of pride, r_c presents m_c with acc_plural as a congratulations for becoming an apprentice.

r_c is so proud of how far {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} child has grown. With a look of pride, r_c presents m_c with acc_plural as a congratulations for becoming a warrior. r_c knew that m_c would do great things for c_n.

r_c is so proud of how far {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} child has grown. With a look of pride, r_c presents m_c with acc_plural as a congratulations. m_c takes it, but as r_c turns away, a complicated expression crosses {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} face. Perhaps {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} had the wrong idea about r_c.
r_c hands over acc_singular to m_c, telling m_c that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} better not forget about {PRONOUN/r_c/object} now that m_c is an apprentice.

m_c is feeling a bit overwhelmed, now that {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/are/is} an apprentice. Luckily, r_c is there with a gift of acc_plural and some comforting words to cheer m_c up.

r_c feels so lucky to have {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} own sibling become a medicine cat apprentice. Knowing how time consuming it is to gather herbs, r_c spends a long time gathering up acc_plural to help out m_c. While m_c appreciates the efforts, none of these are particularly useful. Instead m_c uses the acc_plural to decorate {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.

m_c can't help but feel hurt when {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} sibling isn't there to congratulate {PRONOUN/m_c/object} for becoming a warrior. However, when {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} later {VERB/m_c/go/goes} to {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} new nest {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/find/finds} r_c there waiting for {PRONOUN/m_c/object}, with a gift of acc_plural. Together the siblings work on making m_c's new nest feel more comfortable.

m_c has been so excited for {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} first lesson with r_c. However, instead of something like hunting or moss gathering, r_c takes {PRONOUN/m_c/object} on a tour of the territory. At the end of the lesson, r_c gives m_c acc_plural, saying {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/are/is} glad to be m_c's mentor.

As a new mentor, r_c wants to make a good initial impression on {PRONOUN/r_c/poss} apprentice, and after some careful consideration {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/decide/decides} the best way is a gift. Taking m_c to the side, r_c gives {PRONOUN/m_c/object} acc_plural, telling {PRONOUN/m_c/object} with a soft voice that if m_c has any sort of issue then {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} can come to {PRONOUN/r_c/object} for help.

m_c yowls in shock, claws unsheathing from an unexpected to weight pinning {PRONOUN/m_c/object}. When {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/are/is} able to get up, m_c's surprised and a bit upset to see that it had been {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} mentor who attacked {PRONOUN/m_c/object}. r_c doesn't seem to notice m_c's discomfort as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} excitedly tell m_c about the acc_plural that now adorns {PRONOUN/m_c/poss} pelt.
r_c found a little patch of acc_plural and decided to gift them to m_c.
Flowers can be so pretty, even before they bloom, just like m_c. r_c blushes as {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} {VERB/r_c/see/sees} m_c wear the acc_singular {PRONOUN/r_c/subject} got {PRONOUN/m_c/object}.
m_c thinks StarClan is trying to warn {PRONOUN/m_c/object} about r_c.

m_c finds a stray acc_singular in its last moments of life leading them to a new herb gathering spot before {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/have/has} never found before. It gives a final flutter before it gently decends to the ground. Is it a sign from StarClan, or a coincidence? m_c doesnt know but {PRONOUN/m_c/subject} {VERB/m_c/decide/decides} to keep it with {PRONOUN/m_c/object} in its honor.
